metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12614 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in dlpar_parse_cc_property inarch/powerpc/platforms/pseries/dlpar.c in the Linux kernel through 5.1.6.There is an unchecked kstrdup of prop->name, which might allow an attackerto cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12614` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-159-generic - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-lowlatency - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-159-generic - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-159-lowlatency - 4.4.0-159.187
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-159.187').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
